str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
When, at which time. From hos and te; at which too, i.e. When.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
From ek and a derivative of artios; to finish out; figuratively, to equip fully.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To go out, come out. From ek and erchomai; to issue.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Plural
str2: To travel, journey, go, die.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
With. A primary preposition denoting union; with or together.
A woman, wife, my lady. Probably from the base of ginomai; a woman; specially, a wife.
And, even, also, namely.
A child, descendent, inhabitant. From the base of timoria; a child.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Plural
str2: To send forward, accompany, equip for a journey. From pro and pempo; to send forward, i.e. Escort or aid in travel.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Without, outside. Adverb from ek; out(-side, of doors), literally or figuratively.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A city, the inhabitants of a city. Probably from the same as polemos, or perhaps from polus; a town.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To put, place, lay, set, fix, establish. A prolonged form of a primary theo to place.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Sea-coast, (sandy) beach; shore (of sea or lake), land. From aisso and hals (on which the waves dash).

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To pray, pray for, offer prayer. From pros and euchomai; to pray to God, i.e. Supplicate, worship.
